intro: Claytonia udokanica, commonly known as the Udonkan rock violet, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, often hairy leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, preferring cool and moist environments. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a delicate touch of color to alpine landscapes. Claytonia udokanica is noted for its hardiness and ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude conditions.
